standard_metadata.standard_description: Add and subtract mixed numbers with like denominators, e.g., by replacing each mixed number with an equivalent fraction, and/or by using properties of operations and the relationship between addition and subtraction.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Add and subtract mixed numbers (with regrouping)

hints.content: Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by adding each piece.   $\blueD5 \maroonD{\dfrac{2}{5}} + \blueD3 \maroonD{\dfrac{4}{5}}$

Our numerator is larger than our denominator so our fraction is greater than $1$. Let's rewrite our improper fraction as a mixed number.    [[☃ image 1]]  $ \maroonD{\dfrac{6}{5}} =  \blueD1 \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{5}}$

images.alt: Two equal-sized circles, each divided into five equal sections. Each section is labeled one-fifth. In one circle, all 5 sections are shaded. In the second circle, 1 of the 5 sections is shaded.

hints.content: Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by adding each piece.   $\blueD8 \maroonD{\dfrac{3}{4}} + \blueD5 \maroonD{\dfrac{2}{4}}$

Our numerator is larger than our denominator so our fraction is greater than $1$. Let's rewrite our improper fraction as a mixed number.    [[☃ image 1]]  $ \maroonD{\dfrac54}=\blueD1 \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{4}}$

images.alt: Two equal-sized circles, each divided into four equal sections. Each section is labeled one-fourth. In one circle, all 4 sections are shaded. In the second circle, 1 of the 4 sections is shaded.

hints.content: Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by adding each piece.   $\blueD3 \maroonD{\dfrac{10}{12}} + \blueD4 \maroonD{\dfrac{7}{12}}$

Our numerator is larger than our denominator so our fraction is greater than $1$. Let's rewrite our improper fraction as a mixed number.    [[☃ image 1]]  $\maroonD{\dfrac{17}{12}}=\blueD1 \maroonD{\dfrac{5}{12}}$

images.alt: Two equal-sized fraction bars, each divided into 12 equal sections. Each section is labeled one-twelfth. In one bar, all 12 sections are shaded. In the second bar, 5 of the 12 sections are shaded.

hints.content: Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by adding each piece.   $\blueD5 \maroonD{\dfrac{2}{3}} + \blueD7 \maroonD{\dfrac{2}{3}}$

Our numerator is larger than our denominator so our fraction is greater than $1$. Let's rewrite our improper fraction as a mixed number.    [[☃ image 1]]  $ \maroonD{\dfrac{4}{3}}=\blueD1 \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{3}}$

images.alt: Two equal-sized circles, each divided into three equal sections. Each section is labeled one-third. In one circle, all 3 sections are shaded. In the second circle, 1 of the 3 sections is shaded.

hints.content: Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by adding each piece.   $\blueD8 \maroonD{\dfrac{2}{6}} + \blueD2 \maroonD{\dfrac{5}{6}}$

Our numerator is larger than our denominator so our fraction is greater than $1$. Let's rewrite our improper fraction as a mixed number.     [[☃ image 1]]  $ \maroonD{\dfrac{7}{6}}=\blueD1 \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{6}}$

images.alt: Two equal-sized circles, each divided into six equal sections. Each section is labeled one-sixth. In one circle, all 6 sections are shaded. In the second circle, 1 of the 6 sections is shaded.

hints.content: Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by adding each piece.   $\blueD7 \maroonD{\dfrac{4}{8}} + \blueD2 \maroonD{\dfrac{7}{8}}$

Our numerator is larger than our denominator so our fraction is greater than $1$. Let's rewrite our improper fraction as a mixed number.    [[☃ image 1]]  $\maroonD{\dfrac{11}{8}}=\blueD1 \maroonD{\dfrac{3}{8}}$

images.alt: Two equal-sized fraction bars, each divided into eight equal sections. Each section is labeled one-eighth. In one bar, all 8 sections are shaded. In the second bar, 3 of the 8 sections are shaded.

hints.content: Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by adding each piece.   $\blueD4 \maroonD{\dfrac{7}{10}} + \blueD5 \maroonD{\dfrac{6}{10}}$

Our numerator is larger than our denominator so our fraction is greater than $1$. Let's rewrite our improper fraction as a mixed number.    [[☃ image 1]]  $\maroonD{\dfrac{13}{10}}=\blueD1 \maroonD{\dfrac{3}{10}}$

images.alt: Two equal-sized fraction bars, each divided into ten equal sections. Each section is labeled one-tenth. In one bar, all 10 sections are shaded. In the second bar, 3 of the 10 sections are shaded.

hints.content: Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by subtracting each piece.   $\blueD4 \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{4}} - \blueD2 \maroonD{\dfrac{2}{4}}$

First, let's subtract the $\maroonD{\text{fractions}}$.  $\begin{align} &\blueD{4} &\maroonD{\dfrac{1}{4}}\\\\ -&\blueD{2}&\maroonD{\dfrac{2}{4}}\\ \hline{}\\ \end{align}$  We cannot subtract $\maroonD{\dfrac{1}{4}} -\maroonD{\dfrac{2}{4}}$ because $\maroonD{\dfrac{1}{4}}$ is **less** than $\maroonD{\dfrac{2}{4}}$.

We need to regroup $\blueD4\maroonD{\dfrac{1}{4}}$ so that the fractional part is **greater** than $\maroonD{\dfrac{2}{4}}$.    [[☃ image 1]]    $\blueD4 \maroonD{\dfrac{1}{4}} =\blueD3 \maroonD{\dfrac{5}{4}}$

images.alt: Five equal-size circles, each divided into four equal sections. Each section is labeled one-fourth. In 3 circles, all 4 sections are shaded blue. In 1 circle, all 4 sections are shaded pink. In the fifth circle, 1 of the 4 sections is shaded pink.

hints.content: Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by subtracting each piece.   $\blueD8 \maroonD{\dfrac{2}{4}} - \blueD1 \maroonD{\dfrac{3}{4}}$

First, let's subtract the $\maroonD{\text{fractions}}$.   $\begin{align} &\blueD{8} &\maroonD{\dfrac{2}{4}}\\\\ -&\blueD{1}&\maroonD{\dfrac{3}{4}}\\ \hline{}\\ \end{align}$  We cannot subtract $\maroonD{\dfrac{2}{4}} - \maroonD{\dfrac{3}{4}}$ because $\maroonD{\dfrac{2}{4}}$ is **less** than $\maroonD{\dfrac{3}{4}}$.

We need to regroup $\blueD8\maroonD{\dfrac{2}{4}}$ so that the fractional part is **greater** than $\maroonD{\dfrac{3}{4}}$.    [[☃ image 1]]  $\begin{align} \blueD8\maroonD{\dfrac{2}{4}}&=\blueD7+\maroonD{1}+ \maroonD{\dfrac{2}{4}}\\\\ &=\blueD7+ \maroonD{\dfrac44}+\maroonD{\dfrac{2}{4}}\\\\ &=\blueD7 \maroonD{\dfrac{6}{4}} \end{align}$

images.alt: Eight equal-size circles, each divided into four equal sections. In 6 circles, all 4 sections are shaded blue. In 1 circle, all 4 sections are shaded pink. In the eighth circle, 2 of the 4 sections are shaded pink.

hints.content: Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by subtracting each piece.   $\blueD5\maroonD{\dfrac{2}{5}} - \blueD3 \maroonD{\dfrac{4}{5}}$

First, let's subtract the $\maroonD{\text{fractions}}$.   $\begin{align} &\blueD{5} &\maroonD{\dfrac{2}{5}}\\\\ -&\blueD{3}&\maroonD{\dfrac{4}{5}}\\ \hline{}\\ \end{align}$  We cannot subtract $\maroonD{\dfrac{2}{5}} - \maroonD{\dfrac{4}{5}}$ because $\maroonD{\dfrac{2}{5}}$ is **less** than $\maroonD{\dfrac{4}{5}}$.

We need to regroup $\blueD5\maroonD{ \dfrac{2}{5}}$ so that the fractional part is **greater** than $\maroonD{\dfrac{4}{5}}$.   [[☃ image 1]]  $\begin{align} \blueD5\maroonD{\dfrac{2}{5}}&=\blueD4+\maroonD{1}+ \maroonD{\dfrac{2}{5}}\\\\ &=\blueD4+ \maroonD{\dfrac55}+\maroonD{\dfrac{2}{5}}\\\\ &=\blueD4 \maroonD{\dfrac{7}{5}} \end{align}$

images.alt: Six equal-size circles, each divided into five equal sections. In 4 circles, all 5 sections are shaded blue. In 1 circle, all 5 sections are shaded pink. In the sixth circle, 2 of the 5 sections are shaded pink.

hints.content: Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by subtracting each piece.   $\blueD7 \maroonD{\dfrac{4}{6}} - \blueD5 \maroonD{\dfrac{5}{6}}$

First, let's subtract the $\maroonD{\text{fractions}}$.   $\begin{align} &\blueD{7} &\maroonD{\dfrac{4}{6}}\\\\ -&\blueD{5}&\maroonD{\dfrac{5}{6}}\\ \hline{}\\ \end{align}$  We cannot subtract $\maroonD{\dfrac{4}{6}} - \maroonD{\dfrac{5}{6}}$ because $\maroonD{\dfrac{4}{6}}$ is **less** than $\maroonD{\dfrac{5}{6}}$.

We need to regroup $\blueD7\maroonD{\dfrac{4}{6}}$ so that the fractional part is **greater** than $\maroonD{\dfrac{5}{6}}$.   [[☃ image 1]]  $\begin{align} \blueD7\maroonD{\dfrac{4}{6}}&=\blueD6+\maroonD{1}+ \maroonD{\dfrac{4}{6}}\\\\ &=\blueD6+ \maroonD{\dfrac66}+\maroonD{\dfrac{4}{6}}\\\\ &=\blueD6 \maroonD{\dfrac{10}{6}} \end{align}$

images.alt: Eight equal-size circles, each divided into six equal sections. In 6 circles, all 6 sections are shaded blue. In 1 circle, all 6 sections are shaded pink. In the eighth circle, 4 of the 6 sections are shaded pink.

hints.content: Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by subtracting each piece.   $\blueD5 \maroonD{\dfrac{4}{8}} - \blueD3 \maroonD{\dfrac{7}{8}}$

First, let's subtract the $\maroonD{\text{fractions}}$.   $\begin{align} &\blueD{5} &\maroonD{\dfrac{4}{8}}\\\\ -&\blueD{3}&\maroonD{\dfrac{7}{8}}\\ \hline{}\\ \end{align}$  We cannot subtract $\maroonD{\dfrac{4}{8}} - \maroonD{\dfrac{7}{8}}$ because $\maroonD{\dfrac{4}{8}}$ is **less** than $\maroonD{\dfrac{7}{8}}$.

We need to regroup $\blueD5\maroonD{\dfrac{4}{8}}$ so that the fractional part is **greater** than $\maroonD{\dfrac{7}{8}}$.   [[☃ image 1]]  $\begin{align} \blueD5\maroonD{\dfrac{4}{8}}&=\blueD4+\maroonD{1}+ \maroonD{\dfrac{4}{8}}\\\\ &=\blueD4+ \maroonD{\dfrac88}+\maroonD{\dfrac{4}{8}}\\\\ &=\blueD4 \maroonD{\dfrac{12}{8}} \end{align}$

images.alt: Six equal-size circles, each divided into eight equal sections. In 4 circles, all 8 sections are shaded blue. In 1 circle, all 8 sections are shaded pink. In the sixth circle, 4 of the 8 sections are shaded pink.

hints.content: Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by subtracting each piece.   $\blueD{6} \maroonD{\dfrac{6}{10}} - \blueD3\maroonD{\dfrac{7}{10}}$

First, let's subtract the $\maroonD{\text{fractions}}$.   $\begin{align} &\blueD{6} &\maroonD{\dfrac{6}{10}}\\\\ -&\blueD{3}&\maroonD{\dfrac{7}{10}}\\ \hline{}\\ \end{align}$  We cannot subtract $\maroonD{\dfrac{6}{10}} - \maroonD{\dfrac{7}{10}}$ because $\maroonD{\dfrac{6}{10}}$ is **less** than $\maroonD{\dfrac{7}{10}}$.

We need to regroup $\blueD{6}\maroonD{\dfrac{6}{10}}$ so that the fractional part is **greater** than $\maroonD{\dfrac{7}{10}}$.   [[☃ image 1]]  $\begin{align} \blueD6\maroonD{\dfrac{6}{10}}&=\blueD5+\maroonD{1}+ \maroonD{\dfrac{6}{10}}\\\\ &=\blueD5+ \maroonD{\dfrac{10}{10}}+\maroonD{\dfrac{6}{10}}\\\\ &=\blueD5 \maroonD{\dfrac{16}{10}} \end{align}$

images.alt: Seven equal-size circles, each divided into ten equal sections. In 5 circles, all 10 sections are shaded blue. In 1 circle, all 10 sections are shaded pink. In the seventh circle, 6 of the 10 sections are shaded pink.

hints.content: Each mixed number has a $\blueD{\text{whole number}}$ and a $\maroonD{\text{fraction}}$. Let's start by subtracting each piece.   $\blueD8 \maroonD{\dfrac{2}{8}} - \blueD3 \maroonD{\dfrac{3}{8}}$

First, let's subtract the $\maroonD{\text{fractions}}$.   $\begin{align} &\blueD{8} &\maroonD{\dfrac{2}{8}}\\\\ -&\blueD{3}&\maroonD{\dfrac{3}{8}}\\ \hline\end{align}$  We cannot subtract $\maroonD{\dfrac{2}{8}} - \maroonD{\dfrac{3}{8}}$ because $\maroonD{\dfrac{2}{8}}$ is **less** than $\maroonD{\dfrac{3}{8}}$.

We need to regroup $\blueD8\maroonD{\dfrac{2}{8}}$ so that the fractional part is **greater** than $\maroonD{\dfrac{3}{8}}$.    [[☃ image 1]]  $\begin{align} \blueD8\maroonD{\dfrac{2}{8}}&=\blueD7+\maroonD{1}+ \maroonD{\dfrac{2}{8}}\\\\ &=\blueD7+ \maroonD{\dfrac{8}{8}}+\maroonD{\dfrac{2}{8}}\\\\ &=\blueD7 \maroonD{\dfrac{10}{8}} \end{align}$

images.alt: Nine equal-size circles, each divided into eight equal sections. In 7 circles, all 8 sections are shaded blue. In 1 circle, all 8 sections are shaded pink. In the ninth circle, 2 of the 8 sections are shaded pink.
